availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Talbot Owen (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician. Port Gibson, Claiborne County, Mississippi, native. Married to Sarah H. Owen. Father of Carrie H. Owen. Physician in Jefferson County in 1860. Employed Eliza Atchison as a servant. in Louisville in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 3rd Ward, p. 667.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 3rd Ward, p. 262B.
Find A Grave, "William Talbot Owen (3 Nov 1829-17 Jan, 1892)," Memorial #158203857, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158203857(accessed January 6, 2020).
